001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.nn.training.initializers;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.model.nn.NeuralNetwork;
005import net.tvburger.jdl.model.nn.Neuron;
006
007import java.util.Random;
008
009/**
010 * Xavier (Glorot) weight initializer.
011 * <p>
012 * For sigmoid/tanh activations, initializes weights from a uniform
013 * distribution in the range [-limit, limit], where:
014 * <p>
015 * limit = sqrt(6 / (fanIn + fanOut))
016 * <p>
017 * fanIn  = number of input connections (weights)
018 * fanOut = number of output connections (neurons this neuron connects to)
019 * <p>
020 * Bias is left unchanged (usually set separately).
021 */
022@Strategy(Strategy.Role.CONCRETE)
023public class XavierInitializer implements NeuralNetworkInitializer {
024
025    private final Random random;
026
027    public XavierInitializer() {
028        this(new Random());
029    }
030
031    public XavierInitializer(int seed) {
032        this(new Random(seed));
033    }
034
035    public XavierInitializer(Random random) {
036        this.random = random;
037    }
038
039    /**
040     * {@inheritDoc}
041     */
042    @Override
043    public void initialize(NeuralNetwork neuralNetwork, Neuron neuron) {
044        int fanIn = neuron.arity();
045        int fanOut = neuralNetwork.getTargetNeurons(neuron).size();
046
047        float limit = (float) Math.sqrt(6.0f / (fanIn + fanOut));
048
049        for (int d = 1; d <= neuron.arity(); d++) {
050            neuron.setWeight(d, uniform(-limit, limit));
051        }
052        // Bias left unchanged
053    }
054
055    private float uniform(float min, float max) {
056        return min + (max - min) * random.nextFloat();
057    }
058}
